attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Request Action to introduce a £10 a year national bus pass.
And by requesting this suggest that money raised by the introduction of a £10 be used for the following purposes.
1: to pay towards the upkeep of rural services, of public transport.
2: Each county council or metropolitan district would be funded from the money raised to fund those services stated in 1.
3: this would abolish funding raised through council taxes to pay for the services.
4: This would work on a similar pricipal to the national railcard, and allow those in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland to all use the same facilties.
5: section 4, would abolish public transport schemes in those other countries, as it would be treated as a national(Great Britain scheme). 
6: abolish county council perks, which allow users in those areas, addtional perks.
7: abolsish the 0900-0930hrs start time.
8: future bus passes, should be based on the increase of retirement age, but still permit disabled people, regardless of age.

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
